Controlling Access to an Experience

In this topic you will learn how to restrict access to an experience using access control profiles.

Access Control Profiles are used to control access to experiences. Access Control Profiles are created as part of the Project settings and can restrict access using:

  • Requiring the user to enter credentials (SSO)

For information on creating Access Control Profiles, see Configuring Access Control Profiles. Once profiles have been created, they can be assigned to experiences to control access. To assign an Access Control Profile to an experience, follow these steps:

  1. Edit your web experience.
  2. Click the SITE CONFIGURATION > Access Control in the left navigation.
  3. Select an access control profile for the experience. By default, all published experiences are public.
  4. Click Save.

Make sure you republish the experience after making any changes to the access control settings.
